author: {'steamid': '76561198015100419', 'num_games_owned': 1439, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1491864818}
review:
I won't recommend buying this game because it feels like a waste of time playing it, this is the kind of game I would have done during middle school given the tools.

The only good thing that could get out of this game, would be the gameplay concept. But it is ruined with poor level design and other decisions.

The cons however.... Where do I begin? Everthing there upsets me. The chara design based on the dev's friends/relatives trying to make faces altered with ms paint, the incoherence between if the gameplay is being in bullet time or not (like it sounds like it's bullet time, but some boss fights are litterally car chases with the boss throwing furnitures at the bullet), the story trying too hard to have an early Max Payne style while being horribly badly written, the one instrument solo music playing out of nowhere sometimes while the rest of the game is dead silent, bad physics, the terrible dialogues breaking the fourth wall without meta ("I don't know why it's there, just ask the developper!"), and the fact I'm not having fun while playing it.

This is a game I would have downloaded ten years ago for free because it was a video game school project, not for 4€ on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979392232', 'num_games_owned': 10931, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1436585893}
review:
This game has a fantastic sense of humor - I especially love the faces the characters make as they talk.  The difficulty progression and ability introduction is spot on.  I can't laud the gameplay enough - it's simple and kind of like an endless runner game, but has actual progression and feeling of accomplishment as you beat the levels.  The levels and objectives are varied enough to keep interest throughout, and the game itself is just the right length to avoid wearing out the concept.  The art and graphics are quite simplistic, but doesn't detract at all from the gameplay.  

One complaint is that when introducing a concept, such as bullet time, the button you need to press should be displayed on the screen.  I didn't realize until after a couple of tries that it was only displayed right when you start the level, but not when you actually needed to use the ability.  MInor nitpicking, but the script needs some editing.  There are a couple of grammatical errors and spelling mistakes that should be fixed.  

Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990379270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1435288847}
review: This does not really deserve the bad reviews it's getting. It's a little overpriced, sure, but all in all it's pretty much a decently enjoyable "runner" style game, dodge obstacles, hit the targets, etc. Although it doesn't do anything too new, it's fun to shoot 12 people in the head with the same bullet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967718083', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1435093706}
review:
Intérêt global : ★★☆☆☆
Ride the Bullet est un Indie ou vous prenez le rôle d’un tueur à gage comme Angelina Jolie dans le film wanted : vous contrôlez la balle et ici vous jouez en bullet time comme dans Max Payne ou Matrix. Original Mélange mais intérêt relativement limité. N'achetez que si dans un bundle Indie cheap...
Graphismes : ★☆☆☆☆
Du graphisme de Indie cheap et peu attrayant, on dirait du coloriage fait sous Paint comme on faisait nos jeux avec des applis gratis à l’époque. Globalement c’est assez dégueux/baclé. Une étoile quand même pour les tronches déjantées des personnages.
Musique / Son : ★☆☆☆☆
Pas de musique, pas de lecture des texte, le seul sont est la belle tirée, le shhhh du ralenti et le splash de la balle qui touche un corps.
Jouabilité : ★★★☆☆
Jeu d’adresse qui monte assez bien en difficulté et offre sa dose de challenge. On n’est pas au niveau de skill d’un super meat boy mais on est au niveau de la difficulté du jeu AAaaaaaahhhh. Un des seuls intérêts du jeu : tester vos réflexes…
Durée de vie : ★☆☆☆☆
Durée de vie courte, le temps d’un rêve d’une heure, les énigmes ne sont pas complexes et s’enchainent rapidement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048717779', 'num_games_owned': 1583, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1435254345}
review:
[h1] [strike]  ▃▅▆▇ Ride the Bullet ▇▆▅▃  [/strike] ) ) ) ✒ [/h1]
 Its a realy nice original game, where you can control a bullet and kill all the guys (if you managed to avoid the obstacles).
 I had a loots of fun and of curse there are some levels that you will need to spend more time to remember what you have done wrong before.

 [h1] [u]THIS IS NOT A ENDLESS RUNNER[/u] [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1435059894}
review:
You know those [url=http://ski.ihoc.net]endless ski games[/url], where you hurl down a slope, avoiding obstacles, making jumps, and trying to hit gates? Well, mechanically, this is the first person version of it, with boxy 3D and fake blood, and a cheesy storyline.

Maybe recommended if you like twitch games - I don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153982635', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1435025028}
review:
This is a simple and fun endless runner game where you control a bullet. There's a few obsticles and a few boosts per level, and you have a minimum amount of people you need to hit. When you get a good run it's a really nice rush. I found it extremely easy to map keys to my gamepad and it plays great on my laptop.

For the price it's very reasonable for the amount of content and achievements you get.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986353054', 'num_games_owned': 5468, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1435489687}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013677277', 'num_games_owned': 1711, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1481180133}
review:
PSA: I'm also friends with the developer. He's awesome, and made it solo (as far as I know).

Ride the Bullet is a rather simple arcadey game, where you go through orange boosters to speed up your bullet, blue boosters to keep your bullet off the ground, use slo-mo in trying times, and assassinate people along the way.

The story is quite interesting, with a basic introduction of the character and the world, in just a few slides. Characters speak to you before each mission, and have a small portrait displaying their emotional state as they talk. Their portraits actually look surprisingly convincing, given that they are photos (of Radjor and friends) that were edited slightly, and hair or other accessories drawn on, giving them an interesting character for dang cheap development time.

As you play through the game, new mechanics are introduced pretty smoothly (although they tend to be some variant of "HIT THING WITH BOOOOOOOLET"), and even some difficult concepts are explained with hardly a word from the narrative. It starts pretty easy, but you'll be surprised how difficult it gets, so quickly you won't notice until you've retried that dang vase-smash level 20+ times. The soundtrack is pretty decent (I for one LOVE the theme) especially if you consider the constraints under which it was made. A lot of time is put into establishing locations and characters, and it felt great to finally finish the game, killing a certain baddy.

The art style is pretty simple, but I think it really works for the game. I think the characters really breath life into the world, while the cartoony levels challenge you to work for the next snippet of narrative. I played through the game to completion on both Android and PC (It works on both!), and it ran very smooth on both. When I (just barely) installed the steam(PC) version, I was getting 200+ FPS stable on 1280x720 and ran through a couple levels smooth as butter on my rather sub-par PC.

Seriously, try this game. I am a big fan of noir-mafia esque settings, so I unsurprisingly loved the writing.

P.S: My playtime is very low since I played it mainly through Itch.io.
P.S.S: If you haven't watched it, check out the trailer. It's great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972471577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1432352433}
review: Indie title that demands speed and reflexes as you steer a bullet through obstacles to take out your targets! Fun but challenging to master!
